column4: It's actually the reverse, it's running at too high a resolution
you need to make sure that the horizontal and vertical refresh rates are high enoguh for the resolution you want
then you have too high a resolution in the xorg.conf
It's only set to 1024  by 768 in xorg.conf, but the login screen / max resolution is 1600 x 1200
are you sure you set every bit depth to 1024x768 and that there are no other higher resolutions there?
you can cycle resolutions with ctrl+alt with plus and minus on the keypad too
If I do that on the login screen will it keep that res?
maybe try runining the reconfigure script for xorg again
Tried that, and when I set it to ati for drivers or fglrx for drivers it properly uses my max res
When using the radeon drivers it ignores em
